Additional sponsors: Mr. Biggs of Arizona and Mr. Rutherford

form.official-title: To restore the right to negotiate matters pertaining to the discipline of law enforcement officers of the District of Columbia through collective bargaining, to restore the statute of limitations for bringing disciplinary cases against members or civilian employees of the Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Our Nation’s Capital Emergency Act.

section.header: Restoration of equitable and fair treatment of law enforcement personnel of District of Columbia

subsection.header: Restoration of right to negotiate matters pertaining to discipline of District of Columbia law enforcement officers through collective bargaining
subsection.text: Section 1708 of the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978 (sec. 1–617.08, D.C. Official Code), as amended by section 116(b) of the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Law 24–345), is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Restoration of statute of limitations for claims against members or civilian employees of Metropolitan Police Department
subsection.text: Subtitle M of title I of the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Law 24–345) is repealed, and any provision of law amended or repealed by such subtitle is restored or revived as if such subtitle had not been enacted into law.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
